frame.name: People_by_morality
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains general words for Individuals, i.e. humans, whose specific acts or general behavior is evaluated against standards of morality or rightness. The <fen>Person</fen> may have an <fen>Age</fen>, <fen>Descriptor</fen>, <fen>Origin</fen>, <fen>Persistent_characteristic</fen>, or <fen>Ethnicity</fen>.
<ex>Columbus: Was <fex name="per">he</fex> a Hero or a <t>Villain</t>?</ex> <ex>There are endless disputes about this sort of thing, both in and out of the courts, because <t>wrongdoers</t> will say and do anything to avoid getting punished.</ex> <ex>There are endless disputes about this sort of thing, both in and out of the courts, because <fex name="per">wrongdoers</fex> will say and do anything to avoid getting punished.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Origin
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Origin</fen> is the place where the <fen>Person</fen> was born or lived a salient part of her or his life.
</def-root>

FE.name: Persistent_characteristic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Persistent_characteristic</fen> is a physiological characteristic or personality trait of the <fen>Person</fen> which is concieved of as persisting over time.
<ex>What you'd started writing was an action story with a <fex name="Pers_char">funny</fex> <t>villain</t> and a whole lot of hijinks.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Descriptor</fen> is a temporary condition of the <fen>Person</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Age
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Age</fen> is the length of time the <fen>Person</fen> has been alive.
<ex>At that time, I was the <fex name="Age">teenage</fex> <t>miscreant</t> who was illegally accessing federal computers.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ethnicity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Ethnicity</fen> is the religious, racial, national, socio-economic or cultural group to which the <fen>Person</fen> belongs.
<ex>Imagine the photo ops when the <fex name="Eth">Afghan</fex> <t>evildoers</t> lay down their arms at your feet.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Context_of_acquaintance
FE.definition:
<def-root>An expression indicating the context with which the <fen>Person</fen> is associated.
<ex>Apparently, another <t>miscreant</t> <fex name="coa">from the same radio station</fex> did the same thing to Robert Esche on Wednesday morning, only it was at 5 am</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Field
FE.definition:
<def-root>A domain of activity in which the <fen>Person</fen> exhibits behavior on which they are judged in terms of its morality.
<ex>After the recent wave of corporate governance shenanigans and the backlash against <fex name="fie">financial</fex> <t>wrongdoers</t>, observers say they are witnessing the first buds of a ?greener? investment focus among professional and individual investors.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: villain.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a wicked person or a person guilty of a crime.

lexUnit.name: miscreant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who behaves badly or unlawfully

lexUnit.name: fink.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an unpleasant or contemptible person.

lexUnit.name: bad apple.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a corrupt person in a group, likely to have a detrimental influence on the others

lexUnit.name: malefactor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who commits a crime or some other wrong.

lexUnit.name: evildoer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who commits evil deeds

lexUnit.name: delinquent.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a (typically young) person showing or characterized by a tendency to commit crime

lexUnit.name: low life.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person engaged in disreputable or criminal activities

lexUnit.name: wrongdoer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person that does wrong
